issue.title: Standpipe changes have made mounting the hose almost impossible.

content.raw:
I also see this after testing on the cloud.  we found that (we think) the hose alignment needs the error to be 10 mm ( reasonable) and 0.01 radians in the z-axis (0.57 degrees -- not very reasonable at all).  Maybe I'm not interpreting this block of code correctly, but 0.01 radians for alignment seems almost impossible to achieve in the sim.  It looks like this code hasn't changed in a long time, and our hose attach point performance also recently went down with the drcsim 2.6 release, so maybe this is not the source of the issue. 

Can OSRF verify that mating the hose is actually achievable in the current sim?  All these recent "fixes" since the "freeze" seems to have made it impossible to register a point for this task.
content.html:
I also see this after testing on the cloud. we found that (we think) the hose alignment needs the error to be 10 mm ( reasonable) and 0.01 radians in the z-axis (0.57 degrees -- not very reasonable at all). Maybe I'm not interpreting this block of code correctly, but 0.01 radians for alignment seems almost impossible to achieve in the sim. It looks like this code hasn't changed in a long time, and our hose attach point performance also recently went down with the drcsim 2.6 release, so maybe this is not the source of the issue.

Can OSRF verify that mating the hose is actually achievable in the current sim? All these recent "fixes" since the "freeze" seems to have made it impossible to register a point for this task.

issue.title: Standpipe changes have made mounting the hose almost impossible.

content.raw:
Hi Patrick,

For reference, [here's the code that checks for connection](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/fb10d974e79e1685fcf971b966d097b44551aa24/ros/atlas_msgs/VRCPlugin.cpp?at=drcsim_2.6#cl-909).  If I am interpreting it correctly, the tolerance is roughly +/-2.86 degrees in tilt, and a box region with +/-3 mm linear offset in x and y axis.  I would like to find out why your tests show more stringent tolerance of 0.01 radians.

And yes, in our test runs with cheats enabled, we have been able to mate the hose coupling with the standpipe.

John
content.html:
Hi Patrick,

For reference, here's the code that checks for connection. If I am interpreting it correctly, the tolerance is roughly +/-2.86 degrees in tilt, and a box region with +/-3 mm linear offset in x and y axis. I would like to find out why your tests show more stringent tolerance of 0.01 radians.

And yes, in our test runs with cheats enabled, we have been able to mate the hose coupling with the standpipe.

John

issue.title: Standpipe changes have made mounting the hose almost impossible.
Standpipe changes have made mounting the hose almost impossible.

content.raw:
Please let me know how this is not giving us a point for mating the hose??  

We left the pen, got the point for lifting the hose, and mated it inside the standpipe with no orientation error.  How is this not a point?

[Movie](https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B5rZlEY4C60aWFB4cGd3TGxJSlk/edit)
